intro: Dactylophyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Crassulaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, often showy flowers. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Dactylophyllum species are typically shrubs or subshrubs, with some varieties growing up to 1 meter in height. These plants are adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making them resilient in harsh environments.
